intro: Anthospermum aethiopicum var. ciliare, commonly known as the hairy anthospermum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite leaves with ciliate margins. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. The species is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various soil types.
